entry.title: Welcome RubyZip
entry.content:
Since the beginning Serpico has used ZipRuby for the Zip library. It’s done a sufficient job but it is a mess to install on Windows. Gathering up our technical debt we switched the code to RubyZip along with refactoring the document process. Really RubyZip is a far better option as it’s modern, supported, and installs on Windows.

TLDR

Serpico runs on Windows now. An installer is soon to follow. =)

entry.title: Booting Up the Blog and Support
entry.content:
The first commit for Serpico was February 4th, 2013. Since then we’ve had dozens of contributors, thousands of installs, three appearances at BlackHat Arsenal and a little over 50,000 LOCs written. And that just skims the surface. I am so proud to be a part of something like this.

Up to this point each of us has been contributing in our spare time. Internally we were paying it forward to so many people that helped us. However, recently we’ve hit a tough point. To be able to support the community with something worth using, we need to take a chance in offering a paid option for enterprise customers.

All of the information is on the Enterprise Purchase page (https://www.serpicoproject.com/purchase) or send an e-mail to enterprise –at— serpicoproject.com.
